metadata.label: Tobacco - T6 - Cessation support services
metadata.description:
Tobacco cessation support intervention that provides cost-covered effective population-wide support including brief advice, national toll-free quit line services and mCessation for all tobacco users.
This scenario exposes the parameters for cessation support services that work by providing accessible, evidence-based assistance to tobacco users who want to quit.
The intervention reduces tobacco prevalence in the population by increasing successful quit rates through counseling and behavioral support, which in turn reduces the incidence rates of asthma among susceptible individuals.
Cessation support services include brief clinical interventions, telephone quit lines, text messaging programs, and other behavioral interventions that increase quit attempt success rates.
These services are most effective when widely available, free of charge, and integrated with healthcare systems and mass media campaigns.
Note: For a comprehensive understanding of tobacco control impacts, this intervention should also be run for COPD, Diabetes, and Cardiovascular Disease models.

Baseline Coverage Tobacco Quitbrief.description: The baseline coverage for the intervention

Target Coverage Tobacco Quitbrief.description: The target coverage for the intervention

Scale-Up Start Year Tobacco Quitbrief.description: The index when scale-up starts for this intervention, where 0 == the first year of the time horizon

Scale-Up Final Year Tobacco Quitbrief.description: The index when scale-up ends for this intervention, where 0 == the first year of the time horizon
